messages.content: Give me python code to print hello world
give me python code for a pong game

Here's a simple Pong game written in Python using the Pygame library.
```
import pygame

# Initialize Pygame
pygame.init()

# Set up the window
window = pygame.display.set_mode((400, 300))
pygame.display.set_caption("Pong")

# Define colors
BLACK = (0, 0, 0)
WHITE = (255, 255, 255)

# Define the ball
ball_pos = [(0, 0)]
ball_vel = [(0, 0)]

# Define the paddles
paddle1_pos = [(window.width - 20, window.height / 2), (window.width - 20, window.height / 2)]
paddle2_pos = [(window.width / 2, window.height - 20), (window.width / 2, window.height - 20)]

# Define the score
score = 0

# Define the clock
clock = pygame.time.Clock()

# Define the movement
def move_ball(ball_pos, ball_vel):
    global ball_pos, ball_vel
    ball_pos[0] += ball_vel[0]
    ball_pos[1] += ball_vel[1]

# Define the game loop
running = True
while running:
    # Handle events
    for event in pygame.event.get():
        if event.type == pygame.QUIT:
            running = False

    # Update the game state
    ball_pos += ball_vel
    move_ball(ball_pos, ball_vel)

    # Render the window
    window.fill(WHITE)
    pygame.draw.rect(window, BLACK, (paddle1_pos[0], paddle1_pos[1], 20, 20))
    pygame.draw.rect(window, BLACK, (paddle2_pos[0], paddle2_pos[1], 20, 20))

    # Clear the screen
    window.fill(BLACK)

    # Draw the score
    pygame.draw.rect(window, WHITE, (score, score, 20, 20))

    # Update the clock
    clock.tick(60)

# Close Pygame
py
